column1: Mokena is a name derived from a Native American language meaning "mud turtle".
Mokena is located at 41°32′4″N 87°52′37″W.According to the 2010 census
column2: Mokena has a total area of 8.893 square miles (23.03 km2)
column3: of which 8.89 square miles (23.02 km2) (or 99.97%) is land and 0.003 square miles (0.01 km2) (or 0.03%) is water.

column1: Mokena is served by Lincoln-Way Community High School District 210; students attend Lincoln-Way Central High School. Elementary school services are provided by one of four school districts: Mokena School District 159
column4: and Summit Hill School District 161. Schools within District 159 include MES (Mokena Elementary School)
column6: and MJHS (Mokena Junior High School). Higher education is provided through Joliet Junior College

column1: The Village of Mokena is serviced by the Metra rail service Rock Island District. Mokena has two commuter rail stations
column3: providing service to downtown Chicago's LaSalle Street Station
column4: connecting with components of the Chicago Transit Authority. Mokena is also served by I-80
column5: which runs along its northern border. Through I-80 commuters have convenient access to I-355 (Veteran's Memorial Tollway) and I-57. The main north-south thoroughfares are US Route 45 (LaGrange Rd) and Wolf Rd. The main east-west thoroughfares are 191st St
column7: and US Route 30 (Lincoln Highway). Rail freight traffic travels along both the Metra RI District Railway (Metra RI) and the Canadian National Railway (CN). The CN tracks run east/west along Mokena's southern boundary
column8: while the Metra Rock Island District (Metra) tracks approximately bisect the town in a northeastern/southwestern direction.
